title.narrative: Developing a programme for improving Air Quality Management in BiH
Utveckla ett program för att förbättra Air Quality Management i BIH

description.narrative: Naturvårdsverket ska genomföra en startfas för att utveckla ett långsiktigt program för att hjälpa Bosnien och Hercegovina att förbättra luftkvalitetsbedömningen och förvaltningen i landet.
Naturvårdsverket to carry out an inception phase to develop a long-term programme to provide assistance to Bosnia & Herzegovina for improving air quality assessment and management in the country.

The Swedish Environmental Protection Agency (SEPA) has been assigned to carry out an inception phase and to develop a long-term programme to for improving air quality assessment and management in the country in Bosnia and Herzegovina (BiH). The programme is aimed for Sweden’s support to BIH in area of air quality improvement. The primary goal of this assignment is to carry out a thorough analysis of the current air quality situation in BiH and to develop a proposal for a long-term programme for Sweden to provide expert support to BIH to improve air quality assessment and management in the country. The project adressed the main problem to be solved - the poor air quality in Bosnia and Herzegovina which is steadily worsening, particularly during winter months. This presents an insurmountable challenge (given their current resources) for institutions in Bosnia and Herzegovina in terms of managing and improving air quality. On the other side, responsibilities are spread out over a range of institutions at different levels in BIH, which creates significant challenges for coordination. To that there are perceived gaps in the legislation and inadequate enforcement of existing provisions.

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The Swedish Environmental Protection Agency (SEPA) received funding from the Swedish Embassy for carrying out an inception phase to develop a long-term programme to provide assistance to Bosnia and Herzegovina for improving air quality assessment and management. The inception phase was carried out from September 2017 – July 2018. The activities implemented and the outcomes that were achieved during the inception phase have been summarised bellow. Since September 2018, the Swedish EPA conducted a several missions to Sarajevo and other cities in Bosnia & Herzegovina, such as Zenica, Tuzla, Banja Luka. The aim of this missions was to gather information on the current situation regarding air quality assessment and management in order to develop proposals for providing Swedish assistance. All experiences and knowledge obtained from inception phase were subsequently consolidated and merged in to a first tentative draft programme proposal. The tentative draft proposal introduced activities seeking to fill perceived gaps in current efforts on tackling air pollution in BiH as identified through interactions with BiH partners. These activities were subsequently presented to the broader stakeholder group on site inSarajevo at an open event at Hotel Europe in January 2018. The event provided the opportunity to receive initial input from BiH partners to the finally suggested set of intervention measures proposed by the Swedish EPA. However some details of proposal needed further development and had to be refined through an iterative process together with key stakeholder in FBiH and Republica Srpska with coordination role of MoFTER. The official iterative consultation process was caried out during spring and summer 2018. SEPA deviated from the original inception phase timeplan, primarily due to beeing engaged in a more iterative and collaborative proposal-drafting process than originally expected. Whereas the draft proposal was intended to be submitted to the Swedish Embassy in Sarajevo on the first of February 2018, SEPA requested an extension to August 2018 so that there could be more stakeholder engagement. This engagement was fruitful, with actors in both the Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina and Republika Srpska collaborating with one another to create a project proposal that was satisfactory for all. The final proposal for long term programme has been finalized and submitted by SEPA in August 2018. The financial report provided by SEPA is supported by final Audited Report and Management letter which confirmed that spending of funds was in accordance with the Agreement and no material finding has been found.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
